global.notes: Default: zero tolerance for leaks, max 1MB retained

drawer.notes: Drawer uses portal and ViewStack - may have minor DOM cleanup delays

button.notes: Simple component with zero tolerance for leaks

tooltip.notes: Uses React Aria's overlay system and portal - may have minor leaks from floating positioning during stress tests

dialog.notes: Modal overlay with portal rendering - uses PortalProvider and ModalOverlay

notice.notes: Uses @accelint/bus for event subscriptions and toast queue - critical to verify subscription cleanup

intentional-leak.notes: Intentional leak test page - high thresholds to allow leak detection verification. Tests validate that MemLab correctly detects memory leaks.

accordion.notes: Simple expand/collapse component - zero tolerance for leaks

accordiongroup.notes: Coordinated accordions - zero tolerance for leaks

badge.notes: Simple display component - zero tolerance for leaks

avatar.notes: Image component using @radix-ui/react-avatar. Radix's useImageLoadingStatus hook creates window.Image() objects that persist after unmount during rapid mount/unmount cycles. This is expected browser behavior - pending image loads cannot be cancelled via standard DOM APIs. The hook's cleanup removes event listeners but not the image reference or pending network request.
knownIssues: Radix Avatar useImageLoadingStatus does not clear image.src on unmount
Browser retains pending Image objects until load/error completes

actionbar.notes: Static container for icon buttons - zero tolerance for leaks
